column4: Agasse, Jacques Laurent; agasse, jern-laurent; agasse jacques-laurent; Agasse; Agace; Agus; Agos; Agas; Jacques Laurent Agasse; Agasser; Agass; Agasse, James Laurent; jacques-laurent agasse; agasse, jacques; Agasse, J.-L.; j. l. agasse
column57: was born in Geneva, briefly active in Paris, and resident in London from 1800 onwards.  He put up two of his own paintings for sale in 1801 but both were bought in.  He lived in Goldsmith Street, according to Christie's files, and his collection was sold by Christie's in 1850 after his death.  He was primarily a painter of animals and landscape.

column4: Allan, David; David Allan; Allan; Allen; D. Allan; Allan of Edinbro'; Allan David

column57: Scottish painter. There was a 1798 sale, but the title page of that sale states that there was an earlier posthumous sale.

column4: Arnald, George; George Arnald; G. Arnald; Arnald; G. Arnold; Arnord; Arnold; G. Arnold, A.R.A.; G. Arnald, Esq. A.R.A.; Arnald, G.; George Arnald, A.R.A.; Arnolds
column57: His collection was sold by Greenwood in 1804.  Many of the pictures were his own, and the other works seem to have been minor.
column60: Chr DB:  Mar.16, 1815, Mr Arnold, 5 Fitzroy St, [crossed out] Dennis. Excise, with list of 6 pics, sold Aug.30.  Three of the lots in the catalogue have Dennis' name following Arnald's, and perhaps the proceeds were taken to pay for customs duties.

column4: Ashford, William; Ashford; William Ashford; W. Ashford; Mr. Ashford; ashford william
column57: was a landscape painter born in Birmingham but resident of Ireland most of his life.  In 1813 he was elected President of the Irish Society of Artists.  He often exhibited in London, however, and apparently stayed there at certain periods.  He was part owner of a large group of pictures put up for sale by Vallance in Dublin in 1803 but it is not known which pictures were his.  A group of his own pictures was sold at Christie's in 1804 and a few other miscellaneous works were bought or sold at other times.  All of these transactions are probably his.
